alert.note: Alert for Northern Coos; Southern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 16 at 10:22AM EST until February 17 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...MIXED PRECIPIATION LIKELY TONIGHT AND FRIDAY... .A storm system approaching from the west will spread rain and mixed precipitation over the western ME mountains and northernmost NH this evening. The precipitation will change to sleet, freezing rain, and snow overnight and continue into Friday, gradually changing to snow. It is likely that this advisory will have to be expanded farther south for Friday as the cold air surges farther southward. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 PM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 6 inches, sleet accumulations around one half of an inch and ice accumulations up to two tenths of an inch. * WHERE...Portions of south central, west central, and western Maine. Portions of northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 7 PM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Mixed precipitation is expected with air temperatures falling below freezing tonight. Expect slippery road conditions and avoid travel if possible later tonight and Friday. Even light snowfall amounts can accumulate on roads and cause dangerous driving conditions due to snow covered roads. The hazardous conditions will impact the Friday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
